result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua R Werlein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant is serving
Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant serving

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription & defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety; defendant shall submit to random screens to determine compliance. Defendant shall not enter establishments where the primary purpose is sale/service of alcohol. Defendant shall have no contact with J.P. or A.W.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including AODA assessment/treatment. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment or school or a combination of both.
